info.description: REST API definition for Apache NiFi Registry web services
info.title: Apache NiFi Registry REST API

get.description: Gets the NiFi Registry version.
Returns the current client's authenticated identity and permissions to top-level resources

409.description: NiFi Registry was unable to complete the request because it assumes a server state that is not valid. The NiFi Registry might be running unsecured.

delete.description: NOTE: This endpoint is subject to change as NiFi Registry and its REST API evolve.

401.description: Authentication token provided was empty or not in the correct JWT format.

delete.summary: Performs a logout for other providers that have been issued a JWT.

post.summary: Retrieves a JWT following a successful login sequence using the configured OpenId Connect provider.

get.description: NOTE: This endpoint is subject to change as NiFi Registry and its REST API evolve.
get.summary: Performs a logout in the OpenId Provider.

get.description: NOTE: This endpoint is subject to change as NiFi Registry and its REST API evolve.
get.summary: Redirect/callback URI for processing the result of the OpenId Connect logout sequence.

get.description: NOTE: This endpoint is subject to change as NiFi Registry and its REST API evolve.
get.summary: Initiates a request to authenticate through the configured OpenId Connect provider.

post.description: Creates a token for accessing the REST API via auto-detected method of verifying client identity claim credentials. The token returned is formatted as a JSON Web Token (JWT). The token is base64 encoded and comprised of three parts. The header, the body, and the signature. The expiration of the token is a contained within the body. The token can be used in the Authorization header in the format 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'.

400.description: NiFi Registry was unable to complete the request because it was invalid. The request should not be retried without modification.

409.description: NiFi Registry was unable to complete the request because it assumes a server state that is not valid. The NiFi Registry may not be configured to support login with username/password.

500.description: NiFi Registry was unable to complete the request because an unexpected error occurred.

post.description: Creates a token for accessing the REST API via a custom identity provider. The user credentials must be passed in a format understood by the custom identity provider, e.g., a third-party auth token in an HTTP header. The exact format of the user credentials expected by the custom identity provider can be discovered by 'GET /access/token/identity-provider/usage'. The token returned is formatted as a JSON Web Token (JWT). The token is base64 encoded and comprised of three parts. The header, the body, and the signature. The expiration of the token is a contained within the body. The token can be used in the Authorization header in the format 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'.

400.description: NiFi Registry was unable to complete the request because it was invalid. The request should not be retried without modification.

409.description: NiFi Registry was unable to complete the request because it assumes a server state that is not valid. The NiFi Registry may not be configured to support login with customized credentials.

500.description: NiFi Registry was unable to complete the request because an unexpected error occurred.

post.description: Tests the format of the credentials against this identity provider without preforming authentication on the credentials to validate them. The user credentials should be passed in a format understood by the custom identity provider as defined by 'GET /access/token/identity-provider/usage'.

400.description: NiFi Registry was unable to complete the request because it was invalid. The request should not be retried without modification.

401.description: The format of the credentials were not recognized by the currently configured identity provider.

409.description: NiFi Registry was unable to complete the request because it assumes a server state that is not valid. The NiFi Registry may not be configured to support login with customized credentials.

500.description: NiFi Registry was unable to complete the request because an unexpected error occurred.

get.description: Provides a description of how the currently configured identity provider expects credentials to be passed to POST /access/token/identity-provider

400.description: NiFi Registry was unable to complete the request because it was invalid. The request should not be retried without modification.

409.description: NiFi Registry was unable to complete the request because it assumes a server state that is not valid. The NiFi Registry may not be configured to support login with customized credentials.

500.description: NiFi Registry was unable to complete the request because an unexpected error occurred.

post.description: Creates a token for accessing the REST API via Kerberos Service Tickets or SPNEGO Tokens (which includes Kerberos Service Tickets). The token returned is formatted as a JSON Web Token (JWT). The token is base64 encoded and comprised of three parts. The header, the body, and the signature. The expiration of the token is a contained within the body. The token can be used in the Authorization header in the format 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'.

400.description: NiFi Registry was unable to complete the request because it was invalid. The request should not be retried without modification.

409.description: NiFi Registry was unable to complete the request because it assumes a server state that is not valid. The NiFi Registry may not be configured to support login Kerberos credentials.

500.description: NiFi Registry was unable to complete the request because an unexpected error occurred.

post.description: Creates a token for accessing the REST API via username/password. The user credentials must be passed in standard HTTP Basic Auth format. That is: 'Authorization: Basic <credentials>', where <credentials> is the base64 encoded value of '<username>:<password>'. The token returned is formatted as a JSON Web Token (JWT). The token is base64 encoded and comprised of three parts. The header, the body, and the signature. The expiration of the token is a contained within the body. The token can be used in the Authorization header in the format 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'.

400.description: NiFi Registry was unable to complete the request because it was invalid. The request should not be retried without modification.

409.description: NiFi Registry was unable to complete the request because it assumes a server state that is not valid. The NiFi Registry may not be configured to support login with username/password.

500.description: NiFi Registry was unable to complete the request because an unexpected error occurred.

post.description:
Creates a version of an extension bundle by uploading a binary artifact. If an extension bundle already exists in the given bucket with the same group id and artifact id as that of the bundle being uploaded, then it will be added as a new version to the existing bundle. If an extension bundle does not already exist in the given bucket with the same group id and artifact id, then a new extension bundle will be created and this version will be added to the new bundle. Client's may optionally supply a SHA-256 in hex format through the multi-part form field 'sha256'. If supplied, then this value will be compared against the SHA-256 computed by the server, and the bundle will be rejected if the values do not match. If not supplied, the bundle will be accepted, but will be marked to indicate that the client did not supply a SHA-256 during creation. 

NOTE: This endpoint is subject to change as NiFi Registry and its REST API evolve.

get.description:
Gets the metadata for all bundles across all authorized buckets with optional filters applied. The returned results will include only items from buckets for which the user is authorized. If the user is not authorized to any buckets, an empty list will be returned. 

NOTE: This endpoint is subject to change as NiFi Registry and its REST API evolve.

parameters.description: Optional bucket name to filter results. The value may be an exact match, or a wildcard, such as 'My Bucket%' to select all bundles where the bucket name starts with 'My Bucket'.
parameters.name: bucketName

parameters.description: Optional groupId to filter results. The value may be an exact match, or a wildcard, such as 'com.%' to select all bundles where the groupId starts with 'com.'.
parameters.name: groupId

parameters.description: Optional artifactId to filter results. The value may be an exact match, or a wildcard, such as 'nifi-%' to select all bundles where the artifactId starts with 'nifi-'.
parameters.name: artifactId

get.description:
Gets the metadata about extension bundle versions across all authorized buckets with optional filters applied. If the user is not authorized to any buckets, an empty list will be returned. 

NOTE: This endpoint is subject to change as NiFi Registry and its REST API evolve.

parameters.description: Optional groupId to filter results. The value may be an exact match, or a wildcard, such as 'com.%' to select all bundle versions where the groupId starts with 'com.'.
parameters.name: groupId

parameters.description: Optional artifactId to filter results. The value may be an exact match, or a wildcard, such as 'nifi-%' to select all bundle versions where the artifactId starts with 'nifi-'.
parameters.name: artifactId

parameters.description: Optional version to filter results. The value maye be an exact match, or a wildcard, such as '1.0.%' to select all bundle versions where the version starts with '1.0.'.
parameters.name: version

get.description:
Gets the hex representation of the SHA-256 digest for the binary content with the given bucket, group, artifact, and version. Since the same group-artifact-version can exist in multiple buckets, this will return the checksum of the first one returned. This will be consistent since the checksum must be the same when existing in multiple buckets. 

NOTE: This endpoint is subject to change as NiFi Registry and its REST API evolve.

action.description: The action associated with this access policy.

Bucket.description: The bucket where the flow is located

allowBundleRedeploy.description: Indicates if this bucket allows the same version of an extension bundle to be redeployed and thus overwrite the existing artifact. By default this is false.

allowPublicRead.description: Indicates if this bucket allows read access to unauthenticated anonymous users

createdTimestamp.description: The timestamp of when the bucket was first created. This is set by the server at creation time.

modifiedTimestamp.description: The timestamp of when the item was last modified, as milliseconds since epoch.

requiredPermission.description: The permission required for this restriction

RevisionInfo.description: The revision information for an entity managed through the REST API.

clientId.description: A client identifier used to make a request. By including a client identifier, the API can allow multiple requests without needing the current revision. Due to the asynchronous nature of requests/responses this was implemented to allow the client to make numerous requests without having to wait for the previous response to come back.

lastModifier.description: The user that last modified the entity.

version.description: NiFi Registry employs an optimistic locking strategy where the client must include a revision in their request when performing an update. In a response to a mutable flow request, this field represents the updated base version.

description.description: The description for how the extension stores state

scopes.description: The scopes used to store state

items.description: The scopes used to store state

VersionedAsset.description: The assets that are referenced by this parameter

backPressureDataSizeThreshold.description: The object data size threshold for determining when back pressure is applied. Updating this value is a passive change in the sense that it won't impact whether existing files over the limit are affected but it does help feeder processors to stop pushing too much into this work queue.

backPressureObjectThreshold.description: The object count threshold for determining when back pressure is applied. Updating this value is a passive change in the sense that it won't impact whether existing files over the limit are affected but it does help feeder processors to stop pushing too much into this work queue.

bends.description: The bend points on the connection.

comments.description: The user-supplied comments for the component

flowFileExpiration.description: The amount of time a flow file may be in the flow before it will be automatically aged out of the flow. Once a flow file reaches this age it will be terminated from the flow the next time a processor attempts to start work on it.

groupIdentifier.description: The ID of the Process Group that this component belongs to

instanceIdentifier.description: The instance ID of an existing component that is described by this VersionedComponent, or null if this is not mapped to an instantiated component

labelIndex.description: The index of the bend point where to place the connection label.

loadBalanceCompression.description: Whether or not compression should be used when transferring FlowFiles between nodes

loadBalanceStrategy.description: The Strategy to use for load balancing data across the cluster, or null, if no Load Balance Strategy has been specified.

partitioningAttribute.description: The attribute to use for partitioning data as it is load balanced across the cluster. If the Load Balance Strategy is configured to use PARTITION_BY_ATTRIBUTE, the value returned by this method is the name of the FlowFile Attribute that will be used to determine which node in the cluster should receive a given FlowFile. If the Load Balance Strategy is unset or is set to any other value, the Partitioning Attribute has no effect.

prioritizers.description: The comparators used to prioritize the queue.

items.description: The comparators used to prioritize the queue.

selectedRelationships.description: The selected relationship that comprise the connection.

items.description: The selected relationship that comprise the connection.

zIndex.description: The z index of the connection.

bulletinLevel.description: The level at which the controller service will report bulletins.

propertyDescriptors.description: The property descriptors for the component.

scheduledState.description: The ScheduledState denoting whether the Controller Service is ENABLED or DISABLED

defaultBackPressureDataSizeThreshold.description: Default value used in this Process Group for the maximum data size of objects that can be queued before back pressure is applied.

defaultBackPressureObjectThreshold.description: Default value used in this Process Group for the maximum number of objects that can be queued before back pressure is applied.

defaultFlowFileExpiration.description: The default FlowFile Expiration for this Process Group.

executionEngine.description: The Execution Engine that should be used to run the components within the group.

flowFileConcurrency.description: The configured FlowFile Concurrency for the Process Group

flowFileOutboundPolicy.description: The FlowFile Outbound Policy for the Process Group

groupIdentifier.description: The ID of the Process Group that this component belongs to

instanceIdentifier.description: The instance ID of an existing component that is described by this VersionedComponent, or null if this is not mapped to an instantiated component

logFileSuffix.description: The log file suffix for this Process Group for dedicated logging.

maxConcurrentTasks.description: The maximum number of concurrent tasks that should be scheduled for this Process Group when using the Stateless Engine

parameterContextName.description: The name of the parameter context used by this process group

scheduledState.description: The Scheduled State of the Process Group, if the group is configured to use the Stateless Execution Engine. Otherwise, this value has no relevance.

statelessFlowTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time that the flow is allows to run using the Stateless engine before it times out and is considered a failure

annotationData.description: The annotation data for the processor used to relay configuration between a custom UI and the procesosr.

autoTerminatedRelationships.description: The names of all relationships that cause a flow file to be terminated if the relationship is not connected elsewhere. This property differs from the 'isAutoTerminate' property of the RelationshipDTO in that the RelationshipDTO is meant to depict the current configuration, whereas this property can be set in a DTO when updating a Processor in order to change which Relationships should be auto-terminated.

items.description: The names of all relationships that cause a flow file to be terminated if the relationship is not connected elsewhere. This property differs from the 'isAutoTerminate' property of the RelationshipDTO in that the RelationshipDTO is meant to depict the current configuration, whereas this property can be set in a DTO when updating a Processor in order to change which Relationships should be auto-terminated.

backoffMechanism.description: Determines whether the FlowFile should be penalized or the processor should be yielded between retries.

bulletinLevel.description: The level at which the processor will report bulletins.

comments.description: The user-supplied comments for the component

concurrentlySchedulableTaskCount.description: The number of tasks that should be concurrently schedule for the processor. If the processor doesn't allow parallol processing then any positive input will be ignored.

executionNode.description: Indicates the node where the process will execute.

groupIdentifier.description: The ID of the Process Group that this component belongs to

instanceIdentifier.description: The instance ID of an existing component that is described by this VersionedComponent, or null if this is not mapped to an instantiated component

maxBackoffPeriod.description: Maximum amount of time to be waited during a retry period.

penaltyDuration.description: The amout of time that is used when the process penalizes a flowfile.

additionalProperties.description: The properties for the component. Properties whose value is not set will only contain the property name.

properties.description: The properties for the component. Properties whose value is not set will only contain the property name.

propertyDescriptors.description: The property descriptors for the component.

retriedRelationships.description: All the relationships should be retried.

items.description: All the relationships should be retried.

runDurationMillis.description: The run duration for the processor in milliseconds.

scheduledState.description: The scheduled state of the component

schedulingPeriod.description: The frequency with which to schedule the processor. The format of the value will depend on th value of schedulingStrategy.

schedulingStrategy.description: Indicates how the processor should be scheduled to run.

additionalProperties.description: Stylistic data for rendering in a UI

style.description: Stylistic data for rendering in a UI

type.description: The type of the extension component

yieldDuration.description: The amount of time that must elapse before this processor is scheduled again after yielding.

VersionedPropertyDescriptor.description: The property descriptors for the component.

displayName.description: The display name of the property

dynamic.description: Whether or not the property is user-defined

identifiesControllerService.description: Whether or not the property provides the identifier of a Controller Service

sensitive.description: Whether or not the property is considered sensitive

VersionedRemoteGroupPort.description: A Set of Output Ports that can be connected to, in order to pull data from the remote NiFi instance

comments.description: The user-supplied comments for the component

concurrentlySchedulableTaskCount.description: The number of task that may transmit flowfiles to the target port concurrently.

groupIdentifier.description: The ID of the Process Group that this component belongs to

instanceIdentifier.description: The instance ID of an existing component that is described by this VersionedComponent, or null if this is not mapped to an instantiated component

remoteGroupId.description: The id of the remote process group that the port resides in.

scheduledState.description: The scheduled state of the component

targetId.description: The ID of the port on the target NiFi instance

useCompression.description: Whether the flowfiles are compressed when sent to the target port.

comments.description: The user-supplied comments for the component

communicationsTimeout.description: The time period used for the timeout when communicating with the target.

groupIdentifier.description: The ID of the Process Group that this component belongs to

inputPorts.description: A Set of Input Ports that can be connected to, in order to send data to the remote NiFi instance

instanceIdentifier.description: The instance ID of an existing component that is described by this VersionedComponent, or null if this is not mapped to an instantiated component

localNetworkInterface.description: The local network interface to send/receive data. If not specified, any local address is used. If clustered, all nodes must have an interface with this identifier.

outputPorts.description: A Set of Output Ports that can be connected to, in order to pull data from the remote NiFi instance

targetUris.description: The target URIs of the remote process group. If target uris is not set but target uri is set, then returns the single target uri. If neither target uris nor target uri is set, then returns null.

transportProtocol.description: The Transport Protocol that is used for Site-to-Site communications

yieldDuration.description: When yielding, this amount of time must elapse before the remote process group is scheduled again.

VersionedResourceDefinition.description: Returns the Resource Definition that defines which type(s) of resource(s) this property references, if any

resourceTypes.description: The types of resource that the Property Descriptor is allowed to reference

items.description: The types of resource that the Property Descriptor is allowed to reference
